sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What is the product formed when aqueous solutions of copper(II) sulfate and potassium iodide are mixed together? Write the balanced chemical equation for the reaction and identify the spectator ions.
message_2:
When aqueous solutions of copper(II) sulfate (CuSO₄) and potassium iodide (KI) are mixed together, a double displacement reaction occurs, resulting in the formation of copper(II) iodide (CuI₂) and potassium sulfate (K₂SO₄). The balanced chemical equation for the reaction is:

CuSO₄(aq) + 2KI(aq) → CuI₂(s) + K₂SO₄(aq)

The spectator ions are the ions that do not participate in the reaction and remain unchanged in the solution. In this case, the spectator ions are K⁺ (potassium) and SO₄²⁻ (sulfate).
